revised_title: The Effect of Guanidins on Melanophores in Frog Skin
tldr: The author investigated the effect of guanidins on the melanophores of frog skin. They discovered that guanidins cause the skin to become lighter by contracting the melanophores. This action is likely due to the guanidins affecting the sympathetic nerves in the skin. Calcium salts can counteract the effects of guanidins, causing the frog's skin to return to its normal dark hue.
